title: shop
header: The Want of a Nail General Store
subheader: The walls and floor of this store are stocked with an assortment of strange odds and ends. Bags of flour sit next to chipped statues, and on the shelves, bottles of vinegar share space with wooden masks and stuffed animals.

success.text:
Mikhail leaves you in charge of the store for a day. His instructions are to listen to what customers need, and make sure they buy the most appropriate charm or item for their problems.

You wait and dust the counters for a little while, and soon an adventurer comes in. He's scrawny and thin, and barely fits in his armor. He asks for something to make himself big and tough, and you recommend an enchanted loincloth. It takes some convincing, but he eventually buys it and leaves. Next comes a guy who wants to blend in. Your recommendation of a colourful chameleon coat comes with some resistance, but he eventually takes it.

The next day, a massive burly minotaur bursts into the shop with a huge grin on his face, stinking of sweat and musk. "Me big! Me strong now!", he bellows, before shaking your hand. A few moments later, something taps you on the shoulder. You turn and look up to see a huge chameleon appear, his skin changing to green from its invisible hue. He grins and taps you with his tail again, while he dangles from the ceiling. "Excellent choice! Loving this new body, my friend", he says, before disappearing again. Seems like you're good at this!

im_late.text:

The large german shepherd puts down his watch and looks at the little bunny with a warm smile, but you catch a glimpse of a brief glow in his eyes. In his deep voice, Mikhail says, "Well, I'm sorry about that. It's been hard keeping track of the time ever since my watch broke."

The rabbit's nose pokes out at the center and his buck teeth stretch to form the minute and hour hands.

npcs.name: Mikhail
npcs.description: Mikhail is an older german-shepherd dog. His fur is dusted with grey hairs, as is his fluffy moustache.

dialogue.output: "My name is Mikhail, kid. Though some call me Daddy."
"I own this little store here. It may not be much, but I am as proud of it as I am of my sons."

"Well, back in the day there used to be a lot of fuss over what kinda coins and barters to use for shopping. Eventually everyone decided that we'd just trade using dust. It's the stuff that is left if you disenchant any item, sort of like magic powder."
"Travel safely, adventurer. Make sure to wrap up warm and get enough to eat."
The old dog smiles and shakes his head. "It's quite handsome, I am told. Adventurers these days, so forward!"

Something about that question makes the dog laugh a little darkly. "Oh, hard-working and musky, I assure you. Though only bad boys get punished with my paws. Keep your hands off the merchandise and we will have no problems."
